reviewText: Rebecca Page plays a poor girl who comes across an injured horse. She names the animal Danny, nurses it back to health, and grows to love it. The problem is that the horse had previously been sold off to a wealthy family, whose spoiled daughter , having previously rejected Danny because of his injuries, now wants the horse back. Who will emerge triumphant?This is one of those happy feel good  movies thats  great  for the whole family  to enjoy.  This is a great  G rated movie you will enjoy!Its also  great  that this movie has finally made it to DVD!There are a few extras on the DVD, one being the trailer and the other is a "Making of"  feature which is just  music being played as production stills are shown of  the director  and some of the stars of the movie. These are  color photos.Having  these extras is a nice little touch  to a great little movie!!
summary: A great  girl  and her horse movie!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember the first time I say this movie as a child. Now watching it again at age 30, it's just as good. Sure the movie was filmed in the 70s or 80s, but most everything about the movie still goes. International Velvet is the only other horse movie out there that's this legit! It's a must see for all horse lovers great and small.
summary: The 2nd best horse movie out there! A must see for horse lovers of all ages!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I recognized Coppergate Horse Show in NJ.I showed there a number of times about the same age as that kid in the movie, at the same year.I didn't see me or any of the horses I rode there, or riders from our barn. BUT I did seethe riding instructor at the rail with the same blue bandana on her head drinking her coke. She always drank coke.That was her.  Just a bystander in the movie. I wonder if she knows she is in this movie as a bystander?Good movie for horse crazy kids . and adults.This movie unlike most horse movies kept the same pony for all scenes. They even had a gelding for a gelding. Some movies have a gelding for a mare ( second chances)
Title: N/A
